citation.article-title: Nocardioides ginsengisoli sp. nov., isolated from soil of a ginseng field
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nocardioides ginsengisoli sp. nov.
Nocardioides ginsengisoli (gin.sen.gi.so′li. N.L. n. ginsengum, ginseng; L. n. solum, soil; N.L. gen. n. ginsengisoli, of soil of a ginseng field, the source of the organism).
Cells are Gram-positive, strictly aerobic, non-spore-forming, non-motile, and short-rod-shaped, 0.2–0.4 μm in diameter and 0.8–1.2 μm in length after culture on R2A agar for 3 days.
Colonies grown on R2A agar (Difco) for 3 days are smooth, circular, light yellow–white and convex.
Grows well at 15–37 °C and pH 5.0–8.5, but not at 4, 42 or 45 °C.
Optimum growth occurs at 30 °C and pH 7.0.
Growth occurs in the absence of NaCl and in the presence of 5.0 % (w/v) NaCl, but not 6.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Growth occurs on nutrient agar, but not on MacConkey agar.
Catalase-positive and oxidase-negative.
Nitrate and nitrite are not reduced.
Urease, arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and tryptophan deaminase are negative.
β-Galactosidase and Voges–Proskauer reaction are positive.
Does not produce any acid or gas from glucose.
Does not produce indole from tryptophan and does not produce H2S from sodium citrate.
Degrades DNA, but not xylan, chitin or cellulose.

The following compounds are utilized as sole carbon sources: d-fructose, d-lyxose, l-xylose, pyruvic acid, acetate, propionate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, valerate, phenylacetate, benzoic acid, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, malate, oxalic acid, gluconate, alanine, arginine, asparagine, aspartic acid, glutamic acid, glutamine, glycine, histidine, isoleucine, leucine, lysine, phenylalanine, proline, serine, threonine, tryptophan, tyrosine and valine.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole carbon sources: ethanol, l-sorbose, l-arabinose, N-acetylglucosamine, formic acid, caprate, maleic acid, salicin, malonate, glutaric acid, tartaric acid, itaconate, adipate, suberate, dulcitol, inositol, xylitol, amygdalin, methanol, glycogen, inulin, dextran, cysteine and methionine.
Utilizes N-nitrophenol (50 p.p.m.) and dibenzofuran (50 p.p.m.–150 p.p.m.).
MK-8(H4) is the predominant menaquinone, and iso-C16 : 0, C18 : 0, C16 : 0, C18 : 1ω9c are the major cellular fatty acids.
The G+C content of genomic DNA of the type strain is 70.2 mol%.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan of strain Gsoil 1124T contains ll-DAP.
The type strain, Gsoil 1124T (=KCTC 19135T=CCUG 52478T=DSM 17921T), was isolated from soil of a ginseng field of Pocheon province, South Korea.
